fi.tiko.eatnyeet

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite
      • fi.tiko.eatnyeet.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Character, Compost, CompostCollectPoint, CompostHitArea, Customer, Field, FlingableObject, Ground, Rat

    public class GameObject
extends Sprite
    Important class for the game, all of the objects that has body or needs to have body extends this class.

        public GameObject(Texture texture,
                  float x,
                  float y,
                  float width,
                  float height,
                  GameScreen game)
        Constuctor that gets all of the value except body as argument
        Parameters:
        texture - texture
        x - position
        y - position
        width - size
        height - size
        game - gamescreen so objects can access mainclass

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(Texture texture,
                  float width,
                  float height,
                  Body body,
                  GameScreen game)

        Parameters:
        texture - texture
        width - size
        height - size
        body - body + position
        game - gamescreen so objects can access mainclass

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Called on every iteration, classes that extends gameobject should override this, but also call this so their lifetime and statetime gets updated.

      • render

        public void render(Batch batch)
        Default render which works for most gameobjects, overide if class needs special attention
        Parameters:
        batch -

      • createBody

        public Body createBody(float x,
                       float y,
                       float radius)
        If body is not created before, gameobject can create it for you with x and y and radius value it calls couple other methods to create the body
        Parameters:
        x - position
        y - position
        radius - size
        Returns:
        complete body

      • getDefinitionOfBody

        protected BodyDef getDefinitionOfBody(float x,
                                      float y)
        When creating body call this and pass x and y value to it
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        bodyDef

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision(Contact contact,
                        GameObject other)
        Default on collision, its empty since by default you do not need to do anything. Overwrite this method on subclass to define what object should do when colliding with other object
        Parameters:
        contact -
        other - can be used to check what class it is colliding with

      • endCollision

        public void endCollision(Contact contact,
                         GameObject other)
        Default end collision, its empty since by default you do not need to do anything. Overwrite this method on subclass to define what object should do when colliding ends with other object
        Parameters:
        contact -
        other - can be used to check what class it was colliding with

      • callAfterPhysicsStep

        public void callAfterPhysicsStep(java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void> toBeCalled)
        Saves callable methods or tasks program need to run later on. Purpose is to avoid conflicts with physicsStep so you can use this to make your program do the tasks after it. Good example is deleting bodies from world, that must be done after physicsstep
        Parameters:
        toBeCalled - Method / code that will run after physic step
